alert.note: Alert for Wallowa (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 7:42PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including the following county, Wallowa. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM PDT, gauge reports indicated runoff is continuing from heavy rain due to thunderstorms earlier in the afternoon. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall from thunderstorms is not expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Wallowa County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
